content:
So have you contacted Telstra and asked them why they have blacklisted you sends mail using the IP 115.66.203.112.


But then that address is not a valid IP address. is has 5 blocks. 

115.66.203.112.80  a valid IPV4 address should have 4 blocks and an IP V6 address has eight groups of four hexadecimal digits. Each group is separated from the others by colons (:)  so i is not valid for that either.

So Are you using a VPN that is doing such a good job of hiding your IP address that is is not even using a valid one. Looking at the address a check of the first four blocks and the belongs to a router in Singapore owned by a company called Singnet Solutions Pte Ltd

The last four blocks belong t a company called Lattitude the IP address appears to be in Sydney, but the company is in Brazil.

So are you getting these error when you are connected using a VPN? Or perhaps a free Wifi at a pub or club or a coffee shop.

How are you connecting to the internet?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: It would appear you have added the email address with that customer to your address book. Probably in the collected addresses when you clicked reply. Perhaps disable both features, (capture of the address when you reply to someone and using the address book to set the display name in the message lists.)

I don't fully grasp your problem, but I believe your settings should be these for a Microsoft account:

- incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2

creator: @next

content:
Probabilmente hai sbagliato nell'aggiungere un contatto alla rubrica:

La PEC nel sistema italiano è una particolare email con valore legale. Per ottenere questo risultato la comunicazione tra un mittente MITT ed un destinatario DEST è mediata dal una società abilitata alla gestione della PEC rispondente a precisi requisiti tecnici [1] (GEST). Nelle intestazioni della PEC avremi quindi riferimenti a MITT, DEST e GEST. Supponiamo che DEST, ricevuta una PEC da MITT, voglia aggiungere il mittente alla propria rubrica di Thunderbird. A volte capita che al nome di MITT non vanga associato il relativo indirizzo email ma quello dell'intermediario GEST. Il risultato è che da quel momento in poi tutte le PEC ricevute da utenti di GEST appariranno con mittente MIT, talvolta con la dicitura "per conto di". Per risolvere il problema è necessario cancellare il contatto MITT dalla rubrica. 1. è una semplificazione funzionale al discorso
creator: @next

content: This may work: - highlight folder, rightclick, select properties, then click 'repair
creator: davidsk

content:
Some options:

- copy the profile into the c:\users\<yourid>\appata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles - then, click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'proflies' and click 'about:profiles' - now, click 'create profile' button, then click 'next - now, enter short name for profile, such as OLDPROFILE, and then click the 'choose' button to locate and activate the profile you copied in. and then launch it.

If the profile is incomplete or corrupt, you can still copy components with thunderbird not running, using windows file explorer to copy message files to the Mail\Local Folders folder.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks, David. As I said, I think I accidentally put a very big value in for the top margin -- no idea what it was (just a slip of the fingers), but probably over 300 so that there was no space left at the bottom of the page. I don't know what else there is to describe.
creator: Lindsay13Graham

content: I don't recall a top margin menu option. Was this possibly a config entry? That is why keystrokes did you do? If it was a config entry, you can find it by looking at prefs.js file in the profile and correct it there.
creator: davidsk

content: I went into File > Page Setup and set the top margin there, as I've done thousands of times before. I don't know what keystrokes I did -- as I've said, it was a slip of the fingers and must have been more than 300 because there was no space left at the bottom of the page. Certainly not a config entry and nothing to do with prefs.js. You are probably in USA, so I should have explained that 300 means 300 millimetres, the metric measurement we use here in Australia (and in most of the world).
creator: Lindsay13Graham

content: - if the quick filter' button is visible above message list, click the little icon to its right and select 'table view' - if the quick filter button is not visible, click menu bar and then View>Layout and tick 'message list header' and then the above mentioned icon should be viewable.

content:
click on the 'View' option to see the details, so you can check it out.

Click on 'Confirm security exception' - it gets added.

Certificates are visible in this place

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to 'Security' section
  • click on 'Manage Certificates'


It's possible your Anti-Virus is causing the pop up. eg: deactivate Avast mail shield / stop scanning mail
creator: Toad-Hall
